text:
The 2016 United States presidential election in Hawaii was held on 8 November 2016. It was part of the 2016 United States presidential election, in which all other states plus the District of Columbia voted.
In the presidential election, Hillary Clinton easily defeated Donald Trump and received 3 electoral votes.
Polling.
Below is a table with the polling results in Hawaii. Hawaii has voted Democrat in the general election since 1988.
Democratic.
The Democratic caucus occurred on 26 March 2016.
Republican.
The Republican primary occurred on 8 March 2016.
